sub_concepts.name: Nucleotides
sub_concepts.definition: The building blocks of DNA, consisting of a sugar molecule, a phosphate group, and one of four nitrogenous bases - adenine, thymine, guanine, or cytosine.

sub_concepts.name: Base pairing
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which nucleotides are paired together to form a complementary base pair, with adenine pairing with thymine and guanine pairing with cytosine.

sub_concepts.name: DNA structure
sub_concepts.definition: The double helix structure of DNA, composed of two complementary strands of nucleotides that are twisted together.

sub_concepts.name: Replication
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which DNA is copied, involving the unwinding of the double helix and the synthesis of new strands.

sub_concepts.name: Transcription
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which DNA is transcribed into RNA, involving the synthesis of an RNA copy of a DNA sequence.

sub_concepts.name: Translation
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which proteins are synthesized from RNA, involving the decoding of the genetic code in mRNA and the assembly of amino acids into polypeptide chains.
